files
Class IndexedImage

java.lang.Object
  files.IndexedImage

public class IndexedImage
extends java.lang.Object

Author:
kbok Provides a simple way to create different images depending on the player's color. It just holds pixel data and generates images. This is necessary since Java BufferedImages does not permit to modify the palette after creation. IndexedImages accepts integers as indexes, but they all have to be within the range 0..255. That way you can use InputSource.readUnsignedByte() with these images.

Method Detail

setHotspot

public void setHotspot(int x,
                       int y)
Sets the hotspot coordinates of the image, if there is one. The hotspots defines usually the centre of the image, which is not always the middle point of the image.

Parameters:
x - The X coordinate of the hotspot point.
y - The Y coordinate of the hotspot point.

public void setPixel(int x,

Sets the index value of the pixel at coordinates (x, y).

Parameters:
x - The column of the pixel to set.
y - The row of the pixel to set.
